intro: Rochea undulata, commonly known as the undulating rockrose, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy stems and leaves. The plant produces showy, pink to red flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Rochea undulata is adapted to withstand drought and high temperatures, making it a resilient species in harsh conditions.
